column2: following after February.—I can never understand what kind of a country this Spain really is. The popular customs and rules of court etiquette are quite extraordinary. I do not understand them at all
column3: at all. Today my head was shorn
column4: although I exclaimed as loudly as I could
column5: that I did not want to be a monk. What happened afterwards
column6: when they began to let cold water trickle on my head
column7: I do not know. I have never experienced such hellish torments. I nearly went mad
column8: and they had difficulty in holding me. The significance of this strange custom is entirely hidden from me. It is a very foolish and unreasonable one.Nor can I understand the stupidity of the kings who have not done away with it before now. Judging by all the circumstances
column9: it seems to me as though I had fallen into the hands of the Inquisition
column10: and as though the man whom I took to be the Chancellor was the Grand Inquisitor. But yet I cannot understand how the king could fall into the hands of the Inquisition.
